body: Hi @kaihendry, can you please try `make setup build`?

Yes, that seems to work.

```
[hendry@t480s goreleaser]$ make setup build
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/stringer
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/cover
curl -sfL https://install.goreleaser.com/github.com/golangci/golangci-lint.sh | sh
golangci/golangci-lint info checking GitHub for latest tag
golangci/golangci-lint info found version: 1.4.1 for v1.4.1/linux/amd64
golangci/golangci-lint info installed ./bin/golangci-lint
curl -sfL https://install.goreleaser.com/github.com/gohugoio/hugo.sh | sh
gohugoio/hugo info checking GitHub for latest tag
gohugoio/hugo info found version: 0.41 for v0.41/Linux/64bit
gohugoio/hugo info installed ./bin/hugo
curl -sfL https://install.goreleaser.com/github.com/caarlos0/bandep.sh | sh
caarlos0/bandep info checking GitHub for latest tag
caarlos0/bandep info found version: 0.1.3 for v0.1.3/linux/amd64
caarlos0/bandep info installed ./bin/bandep
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/golang/dep/master/install.sh | sh
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- 100  4594  100  4594    0     0  11571      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 11601
ARCH = amd64
OS = linux
Will install into /home/hendry/go/bin
Fetching https://github.com/golang/dep/releases/latest..
Release Tag = v0.4.1
Fetching https://github.com/golang/dep/releases/tag/v0.4.1..
Fetching https://github.com/golang/dep/releases/download/v0.4.1/dep-linux-amd64..
Setting executable permissions.
Moving executable to /home/hendry/go/bin/dep
dep ensure -vendor-only
echo "make check" > .git/hooks/pre-commit
chmod +x .git/hooks/pre-commit
go generate ./...
go build
[hendry@t480s goreleaser]$ gore
gorename   goreturns
[hendry@t480s goreleaser]$ make build
go generate ./...
go build
[hendry@t480s goreleaser]$ ./goreleaser
```
Surely (matter of taste), it should be easier to build/install than this? Or should I be using the pipe shell method?
you can use brew, snap, the provided shell script or download the tar.gz and install manually... matter of taste indeed.
Is there a way out of interest to just get the x86-64 directly?
Without downloading a tarball, e.g. goreleaser_Linux_x86_64.tar.gz Download the binary directly, e.g. https://s.natalian.org/2018-06-06/goreleaser

you can use the `binary` `archive_format`: https://goreleaser.com/customization/#Archive
Customization · GoReleaser
So to confirm, you *must* run `make setup build` to get stringer? That sucks. Can that be added to the install docs? I shouldn't have to find this bug just for basic installation

Hi @nickatsegment It is in the docs: https://goreleaser.com/introduction/
Introduction · GoReleaser
@caarlos0 Oh, I was talking about the `brew` method, which I failed to mention. Sorry for being an ass. :P
brew method is just the brew install... don't need to do anything else...
This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
